div.p: This plugin allows you to use Coverity to analyze and find defects in C++, C#, and Java source code.

Supported Coverity version
This plugin was developed and tested with Coverity version 5.3.0.
You do not need to configure the plugin before using it.
See the Commander online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill-in the fields as follows:

ul.li: Coverity bin folder - Supply the path to the Coverity bin folder, example: C:/Program files/Coverity/Coverity Static Analysis/bin, otherwise the default location will be assumed.
Intermediate Directory - Provide the path to the directory that stores the code base's intermediate representation and output from the analysis step.
Language - Select the language used in your project.

Build command - Provide the command you normally use to run your build
Note: if the command you provide contains a path, it must be quoted.
Debug - If checked, this turns on basic debugging output.
Verbosity level - Set the detail level of command messages. Higher numbers provide more verbosity (more messages).

C# assembly files - Provide C# assembly files (.exe or .dll) to analyze.
Notes: This options is only needed when you use c#.
Separate multiple file or path names with a space.
Configuration file - Use the specified configuration file instead of the default configuration.
Additional commands for cov-build - Enter any additional commands.
Additional commands for (cov-analyze/cov-analyze-java/cov-analyze-cs) - Enter any additional commands.
Working directory - Indicate the desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.
